intro: Psychotria heydei, commonly known as the "angel's trumpet" or "devil's weed," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Psychotria heydei contains various alkaloids, including the psychoactive compound dimethyltryptamine (DMT). Due to its toxic properties and hallucinogenic effects, it is considered a highly dangerous plant and is often restricted in many regions.
